values:
I'm missing your bed, I never sleep..Avoiding the spots where we'd have to speak and this bottle of beast is taking me home..

I'm cuddling close to blankets and sheets, but you're not alone, and you're not discreet. Make sure I know who's taking you home.

I'm reading your note over again there's not a word that I comprehend, except when you signed it, "I will love you always and forever."

Well As for now I'm gonna hear the saddest songs and sit alone and wonder how you're making out, but as for me, I wish that I were anywhere with anyone making out.

I'm missing your laugh how did it break? and when did your eyes begin to look fake?I hope you're as happy as you 're pretending.

I am alone in my defeat I wish I knew you were safely at home.

I'm missing your bed, I never sleep.. Avoiding the spots where we'd have speak, and this bottle of beast is taking me home.

Your hair, it's everywhere, screaming infidelities and taking its wear.

<FONT color=#cc9933 size=1>I read your info tonight and it said single..I was about to i.m. you but I caught myself. I didn't even feel like talking to you, I just wanted to help. I read your live journal too and it talked about being friends, but that's not what I want. You know,.. you picked the wrong time to want that because before when I wanted it you had your head shoved up your ass, right now I do too so I'll be stubborn and ignore you. After we had our fights we'd always make up, this time I was so sure that the same thing would happen so I tried to prevent it and I think I've been doing pretty good. I see you walking around so different than what you were when I knew you in Riley.. it's so disgusting. You straighten your hair when you're with him, but I always told you it was pretty with natural curls. It's the silly things that drive me insane these days. ..Like how you always hear how your boy has been bad so you say you're going to talk to him and maybe dump him, but then you never do. You knew it was true, but you just didn't want to believe it. I've been there and done that thanks to you. I also hate the way you tell your mommy about someone who's bothering you, but you don't even mention what you've done. You're blaming other people and Britt since you guys aren't really friends anymore because you haven't found out yet it was your fault. I don't care if I'm being harsh anymore you did so many things that I looked away from. I told you so many times that a lot of your friends had problems with Dave, ..Dave the one you lived and died for. If you were me you'd crap your pants because of how funny you are. I hate how you knew and didn't do anything about this and that.. I hate you and it's driving me mad. Your ex-boyfriend (before this one) said he was  fine as friends and I told you when you dumped him he wasn't okay with that but you didn't believe me. I really enjoyed it when he i.m.ed me with his silly threats that no one would take seriously and the nice names he called me. Well, actually it was only one, but he said it about a thousand times. You can't say I'm just like you because Adam means the same thing Dave did to you. The difference is that Adam is basically my best friend instead of a "boy toy" as miss nearbin might put it. It's okay if you hate me.. I don't care about you anymore, but for some reason i miss you.</FONT>
..I'd be lost without you.

..Tonight I went to see The Secret Window with Emily, Na't, and Adam. Ooh, I thought it was scary, but of course I'm a ..well let's say I don't like scary movies because they're just too scary! Robby Richardson and Jeff Bame came along but then Jeff left and Robby stayed. There was this couple to the left of us that was so annoying. The girl would be pissed off one minute and the next she'd be like "oooh I love you so so much!" They talked the whole time too. I picked Emily up and I found out her grandpa was my grandpa's lawyer.. and then I found out her mom works with my aunt. Jeepers, Oswego is so small. Ehh, even though I thought the movie was scary, it was really good so you should go see it! Anyways, I like Johnny Depp. Mmm, I had a wonderful time tonight. Tomorrow I'll be catching up with the science notebook, other homework, and uhh writing more here.

i love you.

I love.. [13 Mar 2004|04:30pm]

1. Sammy Sosa

..I'll get him someday.

2. Andy Roddick


^ currently taking by Mandy Moore, but not for long if I can help it.

3. Pete Sampras

4. Andre Agassi

5. Adam

I love you so much.

            my heart is bursting in your perfect eyes, 
                        as blue as oceans and as pure as skies..

Blahh.. Yesterday stunk a lot I think. In English we had Mr. Mo which was okay because he's really queer which makes him funny. Uhm..Social Studies was extra boring because Matt was annoying me the only good thing was that Mrs. Proud somehow gave me a 75 as an average for the station things we had to do.. but then she found out she didn't add two things so it got changed to an 88. Gramma always yells at us in lunch because the boys come over and sit by us so she says something like "No hunny hunny!" or uhh.. "No hanky panky!" I love her. Math was the usual.. Mrs. Burt wouldn't add in all the papers I corrected for some reason so I'll get a bad grade.. once again. That big blond sub in science was definitely different, and I don't mean in a good way. Uhm, what else? Oh, that scooter basketball thing was so bad. The boys behind me kept touching me and wouldn't stop so Kailyn yelled at them and we moved and sat by Carolyn. Then later Adam came down and sat by me. Uhg. I was supposed to go to the mall today to get American Eagle gift certificates for Sara and Jess seeing how their party is tonight, but I guess they'll have to deal with money. I feel bad this is so boring so I'll stop here.

Bye.

I ever want to see you
It's the last time
I ever want to hear you
It's the last time

A night filled with "remember when." Oh. how I wish you were back again..
Live Journal is being a little mean to be.. I can't get my background colors to work and other stuff, and basically i'm just typing here to see if it looks better so blah blah blah to you!

Breathe in for luck breathe in so deep this air is blessed you share with me
this night is wild so calm and dull these hearts they race
from self control your legs are smooth
as they graze mine we're doing fine we're doing nothing at all.

My hopes are so high that your kiss might kill me.
So won't you kill me, so I die happy.
My heart is yours to fill or burst or break or bury or wear as jewelery,
which ever you prefer.
The words are hushed lets not get busted,
just lay entwined here undiscovered.
Safe from the earth and all the stupid questions..
"hey did you get some?" Man, that is so dumb.
Stay quiet, stay near, stay close they can't hear, so we can get some.

My hopes are so high that your kiss might kill me.
So won't you kill me, so I die happy.
My heart is yours to fill or burst or break or bury or wear as jewelery,
which ever you prefer.
Hands down this is the best day I can ever remember,
I'll always remember the sound of the stereo,
the dim of the soft lights,
the scent of your hair that you twirled in your fingers and
the time on the clock when we realized
it's so late and the walk that we shared together.
The street was wet and the gate was locked
so I jumped it and let you in and you stood at the door
with your hands on my waist and you kissed me,
but you meant it and I knew that you meant it,
that you meant it, that you meant it,
and I knew, that you meant it, that you meant it.

Today was our last basketball game. It was a home game and we won making our season record undefeated (12-0). I just wanted to score once, just once..and I did! I had a pretty good time even thought it was sort of sad that it was our last game. ..well, I had a wonderful time actually.

It's about Friday and Saturday nights never knowing when you'll get to sleep. ..Maybe we'll pull an all nighter and feel like giant poop in the morning, but most likely we'll be dumb asses and have fun.

..who want's to spend the night at my place this friday or next!?

..late at night i'll meet you outside your door step,
 but first, i promise i'll make it look like we're the couple in the movie.
 i'll throw rocks at your window until you  notice me standing there,
 then with just me and my guitar i'll sing you love songs until you start to sing along.
..late at night i'll meet you outside your door step and we'll run away.

I know I'm kinda strange, to you sometimes
Don't always say, what's on my mind
You know that I've been hurt, by some guy
But I don't wanna mess up this time

And I really really really care
And I really really really want you
And I think I'm kinda scared
Cos I don't want to lose you
If you really really really care
Then maybe you can hang through
I hope you understand
It's nothing to you

My heart's at a low
I'm so much to manage
I think you should know that
I've been damaged
I'm falling in love
There's one disadvantage

I might look through your stuff, for what I don't wanna find
Or I might just set you up, to see if you're all mine
I'm a little paranoid, from what I've been through
Don't know what you got yourself into

so this is how i feel.

It all depends on just how hard your looking, that gets you what life brings
So I really don't mind waiting though your half a world away
It's remembering your silly smile that gets me through the day

And I noticed for a short time that I forgot you'd gone away
Through two hole pots of coffee, I washed the dishes and I cleaned the shelves
Then I thought I heard you tell me to stop feeling sorry for myself

tell me baby if maybe we could put the top down
the sun is flying so high today ..hey, come here, come here, can you hear me now?
and the shine off your cherry fenders would be too much, but not too much
with your hand reach out, with your mouth shape the phrase and say:

just so you know
just so i know
just so we know we're together
if i can look in your eyes, and see what i feel is real, then i know we're together

oh, with your eyes, look over, with your car, pull over
that's all it's going to take
cause i have been paying very close attention to your habits

somebody over there at the counter in the diner on the corner in the corner of my mind
where's your face
on a different day i'm someone else too and we disappear together
we fold up and fly away like paper airplines
we rub each others creases and
line up each others angles
and we choose the brightest papers
and we fly

just so you know
just so i know
just so we know we're together
if i can look in your eyes and see what i feel is real, then i know we're together

we could really take our time, we could really get our shapes just right
and fly off each other into the night
where we land is out of our hands
and so in this way we don't stop
we never stop
we don't stop
we won't stop baby

just so you know...

"The Brilliant Dance"

So this is odd,
the painful realization that has all gone wrong.
And nobody cares at all,
and nobody cares at all.

So you buried all your lover's clothes
and burned the letters lover wrote,
but it doesn't make it any better.
Does it make it any better?
And the plaster dented from your fist
in the hall where you had your first kiss
reminds you that the memories will fade.

So this is strange,
our sidestepping has come to be a brilliant dance
where nobody leads at all,
where nobody leads at all.

And the picture frames are facing down
and the ringing from this empty sound
is deafening and keeping you from sleep.
And breathing is a foreign task
and thinking's just too much to ask
and you're measuring your minutes by a clock that's blinking eights.

This is incredible.
Starving, insatiable,
yes, this is love for the first time.
Well you'd like to think that you were invincible.
Yeah, well weren't we all once before we felt loss for the first time?
Well this is the last time.

"I'm dying to know
do you do you like dreaming of things
so impossible or only the practical
or ever the wild or waiting through all your bad bad days
just to end them with
someone you care about
and do you like making out
and long drives and brown eyes
and girls that just
don't quite fit in
yeah do you like them
So yes, I'll see you there.."

"Several Ways To Die Trying"

Pacific Sun, you should have warned us, it gets so cold here.
And the night can freeze, before you set it on fire.

And our flares go unnoticed.
Dimminished, faded just as soon as they are fired.

We are, we are, intrigued. We are, we are, invisible.

Oh, how we've shouted, how we've screamed, take notice, take interest, take me with you.

But all our fears fall on deaf ears.

Tonight, they're burning the roads they built to lead us to the light.
And blinding our hearts with their shining lies,
while closing our caskets cold and tight. But I'm dying to live.

Pacific sun, you should have warned us, these heights are dizzying,
and the climb can kill you long before the fall.

And our trails go unmarked and unmapped and covered
just as soon as they are crossed.

We are, we are, intriguing. We are, we are, desirable.

Oh how we've shouted, how we've screamed,
take notice, take interest, take me with you.

But all our fears fall on deaf ears.

Tonight, they're burning the roads they built to lead us to the light.
And blinding our hearts with their shining lies,
while closing our caskets cold and tight. But I'm dying to live.

"The Sharp Hint Of New Tears"

On the way home,
this car hears my confessions.
I think tonight I'll take the long way.
This weather.
The wind outside is biting.
It has left me feeling tired & exposed.
You've been asking me to bleed.
It seems these kinds of questions
They come too easy to you now.
Your lack of shame comes naturally.
I should not be suprised.
I should have seen it sooner.

You expect me to apologize
for things that you've done wrong.
While you're inciting others.
You're owning up to nothing
and I wish that I was gone,
because you're not going anywhere.

This damp air
is fighting my defroster.
My sighs they ring victorious
& fog this tinted glass.
It's clouded
& so is my head.
The hint of these new tears are sharp.
I try to choke them back.
But it's useless.
I am useless against them.
They are beating me with ease.

On the way home
this car hears my confessions.
I think tonight I'll take the long way.

"Drowning"

Am i drowning you out?
Boasts of defection
If everything was up to me,
I would be gone by the first sight
The first sight of hope I'd be packed up and out on my way.
Time has been spread so thin
And it's just hours 'fore the day begins.
And the things that are keepin you here are not keepin me here.
The things that are keepin you here
will keep me away.

And "you'll be sorry" isn't that what they'll say?
Don't follow your heart 'cause it just seems to get in your way.
And dont ever leave here and mope at you lesuire and straighten out your
crease dear and truth is in a tall beer

Are you drowing your fears?
Pasts of deception
When everything is hazy then everything will be OK
When everything is hazy then you wont be sad that you stayed.
Time has been spread so thin
And it's just hours 'till the day begins.
And the things that are keeping you here are not keeping me here.
The things that are keeping you here
Will keep me away
And "you'll be sorry" isn't that what they'll say?
Don't follow your heart 'cause it just seems to get in your way
And don't ever leave here and mope at your lesuire and straighten out your
crease dear, and truth is in a tall beer...

Thats the end..

Sometimes it seems you're not with me
It hurts me so much, it hurts me so much.

If you need a best friend i'm here, ..i'm always here.

I'll do my Moira laugh until you turn red and cry from laughter. I'll join cross country and sing love songs with you even if I'm out of breath and about to faint. You can smash a pan of cool whip into my face everday if it makes you happy. We'll go to Darien Lake or anywhere else for that matter just to get away. I promise I'll always be there at the end of the day. I'll say I miss you because I mean it, ..i mean it.

It started out quite simply, as complex things can do;
A set of sad transparencies 'til no one could see through,

But least of all the one inside, behind the iron glass;
A prisonor of all your dreams that never come to pass.

Alone you stand corrupted by the vision that you sought,
And blinded by your hunger all your apetites are bought,

But in spite of what becomes of you, your image will remain;
A reminder of your constant loss, a symbol of your gain.

And your friends are together,
Where the people are all gathered,
All along the road you travelled all your days.

And soon you have succumbed to what the others all believe,
And though the lie affects them still it's you that they decieve,

And all at once you're lost within the emptieness of you,
And there's no one left who's near enough to tell you what to do.

You're left with nothing but your self-potential in the dark,
Like tinder resting on a rock, protected from the spark,

But your fire just consumes you, you alone can feel the pain,
And you stand in all your glory and you know you can't complain. 

But you are surely just as evil as the worst my tongue can tell,
For you'll never face my heaven and I'll not endure your hell.

You have lost your chance to mingle with your constant quiet lies;
Deceptions hidden with your lips, but spoken with your eyes.

For I know you for what you are not for that's really all you are.
And your talents of a minor order seem to stretch too far.

And we both know that this masquerade can't carry on too long.
You're deep inside the Pride Parade, but where do you belong?

A long long time ago
I can still remember how that music used to make me smile
And I knew if I had my chance
That I could make those people dance
And maybe they'd be happy for a while.
But February made me shiver
With every paper I'd deliver
Bad news on the doorstep
I couldn't take one more step
I can't remember if I cried
When I read about his widowed bride
But something touched me deep inside
The day the music died

So bye-bye, Miss American Pie
Drove my chevy to the levee
But the levee was dry
And them good old boys were drinkin' whiskey and rye
Singin' this'll be the day that I die
This'll be the day that I die

Did you write the Book of Love
And do you have faith in God above
If the Bible tells you so
Do you believe in rock 'n roll
Can music save your mortal soul
And can you teach me how to dance real slow
Well, I know that you're in love with her
'Cause I saw you dancin' in the gym
You both kicked off your shoes
Man, I dig those rhythm and blues
I was a lonely teenage broncin' buck
With a pink carnation and a pickup truck
But I knew I was out of luck
The day the music died

I started singin'

Singin' this'll be the day that I die
This'll be the day that I die

Now for ten years we've been on our own
And moss grows fat on a rollin' stone
But that's not how it used to be
When the jester sang for the King and Queen
In a coat he borrowed from James Dean
And a voice that came from you and me
Oh, and while the King was looking down
The jester stole his thorny crown
The courtroom was adjourned
No verdict was returned
And while Lenin read a book of Marx
The quartet practiced in the park
And we sang dirges in the dark
The day the music died 

We were singing
So bye-bye, Miss American Pie
Drove my chevy to the levee

And them good old boys were drinkin' whiskey and rye
Singin' this'll be the day that I die
This'll be the day that I die

Helter Skelter in a summer swelter
The birds flew off with a fallout shelter
Eight miles high and falling fast
It landed foul out on the grass
The players tried for a forward pass
With the jester on the sidelines in a cast
Now the half-time air was sweet perfume
While the Sergeants played a marching tune
We all got up to dance
Oh, but we never got the chance
'Cause the players tried to take the field
The marching band refused to yield
Do you recall what was revealed
The day the music died

We started singing
So bye-bye, Miss American Pie
Drove my chevy to the levee
But the levee was dry
And them good old boys were drinkin' whiskey and rye
Singin' this'll be the day that I die
This'll be the day that I die

Oh, and there we were all in one place
A generation Lost in Space
With no time left to start again
So come on, Jack be nimble, Jack be quick
Jack Flash sat on a candlestick
'Cause fire is the Devil's only friend
Oh, and as I watched him on the stage
My hands were clenched in fists of rage
No angel born in hell
Could break that Satan's spell
And as the flames climbed high into the night
To light the sacrificial rite
I saw Satan laughing with delight
The day the music died

He was singing
So bye-bye, Miss American Pie
Drove my chevy to the levee
But the levee was dry
And them good old boys were drinkin' whiskey and rye
Singin' this'll be the day that I die
This'll be the day that I die



I met a girl who sang the blues
And I asked her for some happy news
But she just smiled and turned away
I went down to the sacred store
Where I'd heard the music years before
But the man there said the music woudn't play
And in the streets the children screamed
The lovers cried, and the poets dreamed
But not a word was spoken
The church bells all were broken
And the three men I admire most
The Father, Son and the Holy Ghost
They caught the last train for the coast
The day the music died

And they were singing
So bye-bye, Miss American Pie
Drove my chevy to the levee
But the levee was dry
And them good old boys were drinkin' whiskey and rye
Singin' this'll be the day that I die

This doubt is screaming in my face
In this familiar place,
Sheltered and concealed
And if this night won't let me rest
Don't let me second guess
What i know to be real put away
All i know for tonight and maybe i just might learn
To let it go take my security from me
And maybe finally i won't have to know everything
I am falling into grace to the unknown to where you are
And faith makes everybody scared it's the unknown,
The don't - know that keeps me hanging on

I cannot pretend that everything makes sense
But does it really matter now if i do not know how
To figure this thing out
I am against myself again trying to fit
These pieces in walking on a cloud of dust to get to you

Uhg.. I don't like to talk about problems and it's a really confusing thing and I'm not expecting you or want you to understand. Some people think I've been down and depressed and different than before, but maybe I act the way I do because I don't have a best friend anymore. I have a lot of friends, but none of them are really like Carolyn, Britt, and Chelsea. Adam definitely could actually be considered a best friend, but I'm always worried that he'll be gone and ..( I don't want to go down this road). There's Na't, but I don't know I need a girl. Emily and Corrine have to be the closest girls right now, but they have a whole bunch of other close friends and a best friend is like the one person you do everything with and such. Christian's pretty cool since she may feel the way I do, but she has a lot of other closer friends and most of the Kingsford girls already mapped out who their best friends are. ..Carolyn I never see since she's on East, but if we were together more we would definitely be best friends like we were in the Riley days. Philip is always there to cheer me up, but I don't know.. Britt can't be described right now, we always change and (I can't describe this at all!) Jackie's my sister and she's clueless about this and I don't like to talk about things I'd rather talk to people who already know about the problem. Robby is always there, but I don't know. Basically it's Adam is the only one because he's always there when he doesn't need to be and he understands me completely and I'm not saying it just because I like him a lot, I'm saying it because it's true. Like I said before though uhg, I'm just afraid of losing him too.

let's change my unhappy point of view because i'm tired of being depressed over you.

we'll stay out late under the stars until we're done counting them all,
your arms around my waist..my head on your shoulder.
and i'll feel the beat of your heart going along with mine..
we'll sing to your favorite song over and over again.
i'll make a wish on the first star i see praying you'll never leave me..
let's never stop counting the stars we see except for the ones in our eyes,
and if you swear i'll swear, i'll never stop singing just as long as you're here.
we'll stay out late every night side by side looking at the stars counting them all,
i'll fall for you like a falling star, promise to catch me, promise. ..i'll fall.

..and I was just wondering if tomorrow night my hands would be around your neck and yours would be placed around my waist.. I might pinch myself out of no where because I don't think you've realized this is what I've wanted all along. ..Maybe I forgot to say it before, but I'm saying it now.. This is what I've wanted all along.

Did you get scared standing alone in the crowd?
did you give up when i was nowhere to be found?
did you get tired of being left all alone?
do you feel better now that you're on your own?
there's nothing without you. the days once had are through.
i'm lost, broken, confused but i won't give up on you ...
tonight all i see is your face on everyone else.
and now i know how scared you were all by yourself.
when the phone rings do you ever hope that it's me?
do you ever dream of a day when we will still be?
there's nothing without you. the days once had are through.
i'm lost, broken, confused but i won't give up on you ...
tonight i'll lie here all alone wondering what our future holds.
and my life should fall apart would you still care?
would you still care? there's nothing without you.
the days once had are through.
i'm lost, broken, confused ..lost, broken, confused but ...
i won't give up on you i won't give up on you tonight.

It was a late Thursday night,
When I decided to write this song,
Just me by well, my dirty floor,
All the earth is gone,
Everyone's asleep,
But the TV is still on,
Debating the past 3 years,
What I did right and wrong,

So tell me is this world we live in alright?
Why does every conversation end in a fight?
Why does every fight keep us apart tonight?
Cause I'm trying to see the sun rise today.

I've been burning bridges,
always burning bridges.

Just took a life,
But do you know,
At twenty-two,
I've learned that i need to know,
I've made mistakes,
I've burned a bridge,
Apologize? What?
There's only one life to live,
When everybody's gone,
And the radio's still on,
That's when I realize,
Until I need to carry on,

So tell me is this world we live in alright?
Why does every conversation end in a fight?
Why does every fight keep us apart tonight?
Cause I'm trying to see the sun rise today.

I've been forgetting to include basketball lately.. We're 3-0, three wins. The first game was a home game against ESM, they weren't really good but some of them were nice. One bit me. *smile* We won by a lot, I can't really remember the score though. Also,..I was a bench warmer for B team the first two games!. *there's another smile* We played Fulton a couple days ago. It was really weird because it would be really close and then we'd be beating them by a lot. The times when it was really close was when B team (me) were doing really bad and a midget girl would get 5 lay up, 10 points in a row for her team.. We ended up winning by over 20 I think. We changed in their men's room though.. I walked in the bathroom and there was a urinal. I was like, "woah, why is this here!?" I thought maybe it was a men's room but then turned into a women's, but then everyone told me it was the men's.. After the game Jess tried to describe some Chinese noodles that I still don't understand and we talked for a while until my dad came. We were walking by the 8th grade team on the way out and you know they did their little coughs on purpose.. Blah meanies. On the bus before the Fulton game Britt forgot her shorts and shoes and we can't play without the right shorts.. so the 8th grade coach was wicked nice and asked one of the 8th grade girls to lend theirs to Britt and her mom came with her old shoes since she left everything in her gym locker. Our last game was a home game against CNS. This game would be described as.. "wow" ..with a jaw drop. It was like half basketball half wrestling match.. I mean, it's okay to be rough and physical in basketball, but not like how they played. Our game was supposed to start at 4:30 but it didn't start until sometime after 6:30 because their bus hit a cop car by the Ed Center. Their point guards were really mean and snobby. If the ref called a foul on them they'd blame someone else and whine to their coach and she'd be all sympathetic. The A team point guard had a big attitude and was mean.. and the B team point guard was angry a lot. On jump balls she'd freak out and scream, "GET OFF OF ME!!" when no one was on her. My girl I had to guard wasn't that good, she was nice though. We only played 4 quarters instead of 5. B team played the end of the game we were winning like 44 to 8, something like that. Their B team point guard fouled out and then they tried to put the A team point guard in, but she had already fouled out. It was pretty funny. The ref was like "No, no you don't she already fouled out find someone else and get off the court!" She gave one of her looks like she didn't do anything then the ref said.."jessuss cchhriistt!" Somewhere in the middle of the game.. One of the refs was rolling the ball to the other for foul shots so I tipped it the other way to get to him but he moved.. So he stood there and waited for me to go get it, but then I bounced it to him but he wasn't looking and it hit him in the butt so my team was laughing then I waddled up to him and handed it to him *smile!* Adam, Emily, Travis, and Na't were there along with a couple others. I haven't scored yet these three games because I suck.. Anyways, one of the times when Adam was watching I was passing in the ball for the Texas play and he yelled out "go jesse!" I turned around half way to look at him, but I didn't see him. I thought it was cute. ..Blahh, there was another smile. I'm going to go eat or clean, I should write more later kids.
You can't hide standing under these stars. I know everything, I know who you are..
..i love the good times that you wreck.
..when you reach the other side wait for me.

I've been searching for a reason and I'm running out of time,

I can tell that it's the season, ..it's time to make up my mind.

..I need to thank you.

It's hard to explain how happy I am that you're just here.. and I feel like I'm not saying it enough but I want you to know it. I could keep going on and on in this journal entry about how much you mean to me, but then I'd feel all cheesy and stuff. I don't think it matters if we met in a strange way, but the fact is that we did. You're always here when you don't need to be and when there's no one else there's always you. I don't know where I'd be if I wouldn't have you to talk to when I'm nothing but down, and you always find a way to put me back to normal, to make me smile. There's no need for me to impress anyone because you're the only one and you except me just the way I am, ..even when I'm off a couple days of the week *smile.*

Thank you for "Rainbow Days"

                  ..and I love you.

Today school was okay.. I can't remember anything that stood out a lot. I helped out Mrs. Proud with getting signatures for the Valentines dance this Friday. Amanda Reno, Jessie B., and I went all through the upper halls trying to get signatures, but out of the like twenty we went to,..we got 8 not including some of the West teachers though. The end of the math midterm thing was today too. I think I did good, but every time I say that I end up doing really bad. Our first basketball game was today, and it was a home game. I did really bad.. I kept falling and this girl, it's hard to believe.. but she bit me! I kept falling like right under the basket or around there.. I had to have the trainer lady put some stuff on my bite mark..wow, that sounds weird knowing it should normally me a scratch! It hurt after the girl did it, but I guess I started bleeding and I didn't know because when I went to wipe my face there was blood and Britt told me it was bleeding..I got to play more though. This girls way of defense was doing the bear hug thing.. It got really annoying after a while. I didn't score.. Woah, but I sure did love my tiny little crowd! *Emily, Adam, and Na't!* They yelled out like "Go Jesse" once, I at least think that's what they said. *smile*. Then Adam and Emily kept blowing me kisses when I was waiting for the lady to come put alcohol stuff and a band-aide on me. ..I'd have to say they were the best part of the game even though I sucked a ton.

Sigh..
..it's rare someone stumbles across the perfect person. I'm glad we met the akward way we did.

Who couldn't love the Flinstones..?

         And we can't forget the gang..

                               

Yeah.. let's take a look to the future.. The Jetsons!

..they left out Rosie who in a way remindes me of the awesome Lunch Lady..*Grandma*

But what ever you do.. don't type in "The Jetsons" or "The Jetson Family" on google images. For some wicked weird reason they made perverted animated..picture things of the dad and daughter doing.."things."

To conclude this entry, ..where would we be without "Rainbow Days"?
